name: Red Hook Coffee & Tea

attributes.Ambience: {'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}
attributes.GoodForMeal: {'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': True, 'breakfast': True}

categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Vegan, Bagels, Food, Coffee & Tea

text: I love red hook. I order very frequently and always purchase a side order of extra sauce for .50. I ordered two this time and got a teaspoon of each sauce, I'm not sure why it's never consistent. I feel ripped off paying for this sauce.

This is my go-to place for breakfast in Queen Village. Consistently delicious sandwiches and some of the best cold brew I've ever tasted at very reasonable prices. The Peacher Man is a consistent favorite but the Lil' Goat and breakfast burrito are also yummy. I'm writing this as I stuff my face with yet another SEC.

my boyfriend and visited red hook coffee and tea this weekend and oh my goodness that breakfast of champion sandwich is SOOOO GOOD. it had soo many flavors that complement each other. It has a nice kick to it but not too much. Customer service was great as well. Great portion size. 

I will most definitely be returning. Highly recommend.

I got the egg and cheese sandwich. I never leave reviews but it was genuinely inedible. Not saying this place as a whole is bad but DO NOT order the egg and cheese sandwich. It was the worst one I've ever had. Literally took 3 bites and threw the rest out.

I got the Sweet Baby Bleu egg sandwich (but requested goat cheese instead of bleu) and it's was one of the best things I've eaten in philly. I cannot recommend this sandwich enough. I'm absolutely going back to this place again!

A friend recommended this spot to me, and it did not disappoint! It was fairly easy to find a street parking spot on a weekday morning, and I walked up to order a coffee and breakfast sandwich. Highly, highly recommend the peacher man - it's a sandwich with egg, veggie sausage, and peach jam, and it was delicious! The coffee was great too. I'd definitely come back here again for coffee or takeout breakfast.
No hyperbole- some of the yummiest sandwiches I've ever eaten!! We also got the iced turmeric, honey latte which was delicious as well! Counting down the days until I go back

I really like this place. The menu is a good size and lots of different options than most coffee places. I have always enjoyed my lattes. I love that they have peppermint during holiday season. I usually get the juevos banditos wrap and it is delicious. I recently tried the celestial bagel and while it is delicious and loaded with lettuce, tomatoes, tempeh and a creamy sauce it does fall apart a little as you eat it. Their service has always been fine and they have a few tables with chairs outside to sit as you wait or enjoy your food there. Will continue to go here and explore their menu.

BEST SANDWICHES EVER.

The gluten free bread options alone would keep me coming back but the sandwiches themselves are incredible. Love the sides of potato salad and plan to try a salad soon. The online order and window pickup makes it the perfect lunchtime order spot.

Knocked off 1 star because I'm not a huge fan of their latte flavors and wouldn't come here for only a drink, but the quality of food makes up for it.

Red Hook is my go-to coffee shop in the neighborhood. Their cold brew is intense and delicious; even if I get food from another place, I'll stop in Red Hook just to get the cold brew.
Today I got the seasonal maple rosemary latte, which was perfectly made: not too sweet or heavy on the rosemary. I also ordered lunch for the first time. I got the Peacher Man sandwich, which was SO delicious and even better than I was expecting. They served it with a side of delicious, tangy potato salad.
The prices are all very reasonable, especially given the great quality of the food and beverages.

We order from here at least 3 times a week and every time they get the order wrong. Ordered iced and given hot. The lattes are great when it's done right, but lately it's all milk. $5 for milk, basically. Always confusion when picking up. Frustrating to not get what you paid for.

Just moved close to this place and have been looking for my new favorite coffee spot. I got a caramel iced latte with oat milk, and it was pretty good. I know they have caramel syrup and real caramel, and I think they put real caramel in mine which made it a little harder to incorporate into my drink. It was still good though. My boyfriend also got a really good hot chai latte that he likes more than the other chai he's tried around the neighborhood.

They now take credit cards and offer online order ahead!  Easy pick up through a window on the street.  Their sandwiches are so healthy and hearty, it just gives you a warm fuzzy feeling.  It's like homey comfort food that doesn't fill you with regret afterward.  There's a ton of add-ons that are either free or cheap (50c), so it's easy to customize.  The multi grain bread is perfect, and the Veggie Hook sandwich is amazing, especially with a little something tangy (vinaigrette, lemon juice, etc.) and cheese.  Love this place.

Favorite coffee shop in the city! Cool bad ass barista girls, great prices, unpretentious atmosphere. I recommend the chicken salad sandwich and the iced red eye. Cash only, but there's an ATM inside with a low fee.

I've always said  metal and coffee go together, and red hook finally proved me right.  Funky and cool vibe, with good food options, too.  Hang out or get coffee on the go if you're in queen village.  I was a bit surprised that they charged me extra because I didn't have a face tattoo.  But, I understand.

We were searching vegan breakfast options that were near Dottie's Donuts (vegan donuts) and came across this place. The boyfriend ordered a Vegan Elvis (peanut butter, banana, agave and vegan bacon then pan fried) and fell in love! It came with a side of vegan potato salad. Would definitely recommend to a vegan and/or non-vegan. It looked and tasted delicious (picture included for drooling purposes). 

I went with a toasted sesame bagel with cream cheese and bacon. Simple but delicious--I promise you. I was expecting bacon strips but it was covered in bacon bits so every bite was perfect!

We were both happy with the choice and agreed it's definitely a spot we'd come back to when in Philly. Don't hesitate, just go! You won't regret it.

We were searching vegan breakfast options that were near Dottie's Donuts (vegan donuts) and came across this place. The boyfriend ordered a Vegan Elvis (peanut butter, banana, agave and vegan bacon then pan fried) and fell in love! It came with a side of vegan potato salad. Would definitely recommend to both a vegan and/or non-vegan. It looked and tasted delicious (picture included for drooling purposes). 

I went with a toasted sesame bagel with cream cheese and bacon. Simple but delicious--I promise you. I was expecting bacon strips but it was covered in bacon bits so every bite was perfect!

We were both happy with the choice and agreed it's definitely a spot we'd come back to when in Philly. Don't hesitate, just go! You won't regret it.
Delicious whole wheat cream cheese bagels! The cappuccino is very foamy, which I love.

I come here almost everyday, and it is incredible. The staff is so nice and the food is delicious. The BLT is simply amazing. I also eat the chicken salad very frequently, and it is such a unique and tasty recipe. My friend visits from a couple hours away to have the sweet baby bleu. Way more than just a coffee shop. Really interesting art as well. You're in for a treat if you get the chance to stop by.

I have been here multiple times. I try something new each visit and they never disappoint. The atmosphere is amazing to have a quick bite and read the paper. Don't forget they are cash only but if you do, they have an atm on premise

I feel silly reviewing this place since I haven't actually had the coffee here yet, but the food is my idea of heaven!!  Simple but perfectly executed, fresh, healthy, tons of veggie options, very reasonably priced.  The sandwich was so big I had to take half of it home!  It even came with a little side of potato salad, which was divine.  This place has cozy, down to earth cafe vibes, but is still hip enough to have good music.  The staff was kind and helpful.  I'll definitely come back to try the coffee, and the rest of the menu!!  The only drawback is it's cash only, so come prepared.

Excellent food, friendly people, awesome relaxed atmosphere. Our breakfast sandwiches were both phenomenal and their side of the day was yummy too. The cafe pairs fruit spreads with savory items to create really unique sandwiches. It was filling and perfectly priced. We are planning on returning on a weekly basis (if not more).

One of my favorite brunch spots in the city. It's v cozy and the food is great. They have a nice vegan selection and their coffees/teas are generally unique and delicious. 

The service is always quick and the food is always good.
I really dig this place for breakfast. Comfortable with quality food. Great coffee as well. One of the better spots around. I definitely recommend.

Quiet little Cafe with lots of character and charm! We had breakfast here while visiting Old Town Philadelphia and were pleasantly surprised!! I eat a Gluten Free, Vegan diet and avoid Oats as well. 

The staff were knowledgeable and very accommodating to my dietary needs and the breakfast was delicious!! I ordered Breakfast Tacos with a couple adjustments, no egg add tofu sauce, with no toasting to prevent cross contamination (their suggestion). This was a great start to our day and affordable! Oh by the way, they are a Cash Only establishment with an ATM on site.
This place is amazing. Cash only and takes a bit for your food but totally worth it. Even my meat-and-potatoes husband enjoyed his meal. A+!

Great spot. Awesome coffees. Good breakfast eats. 
Chill vibe. Friendly attentive laid back staff. 
3 brands of fizzy water 
No OJ. Just bottled drinks. Add juice options and it gets a solid 5 stars. 
Cash only. Very reasonably priced.
I come here almost everyday, and it is incredible. The staff is so nice and the food is delicious!

Love this gem! Chicken salad is amazing and you can not go wrong with the elvis! Always a great treat with the potato salad. Don't forget to get the Iced coffee. Lots of options for all diets!! Staff is always friendly and walking in you instantly smell the goodness

Can I just start with the lil side of potato salad that comes with your sandwich? Oh Em Geee, I've never had a potato salad quite as tasty - potato's, garbanzos, cranberries, mustard and just enough mayo to make it stick together. Now, if you told me those ingredients before I tasted it I'd probably say "eww, yuck" but luckily I was hungry this morning and was adventurous enough to try it and let me tell you "mmm, yum!". I mean even after I had my massive behemoth Shades of Egg sandwich (seriously, I HAD to share half with my husband, there was no way I could finish it). The cafe is cute, very homey, service could use a little more friendliness but overall, amazing food!!
Fast service. Great food, and an edgy environment. There's something for everyone. Try the mango smoothie it's refreshing
The BLT&A was fantastic. Great atmosphere and huge portions.  Love the breakfast all day.

Yall their sandwiches are AMAZING! The vegan BLTA and the vegan chicken salad are on point. The potato salad is amazing too. The multigrain bread is so good too like idk how. All the food I've had here is great. I always get good service as well. HOWEVER I dock one star because the coffee could definitely be stronger. I always need to add an extra shot to everything here (but an extra shot is only .50 extra so it's not a huge deal at least)

Love the ambience here as well as the menu. I've been stopping by for iced coffees or the mango avocado smoothie (awesome with soy milk) and a bagel with tofutti, and love all of these. Today I tried their vegan chicken salad with the potato salad on the side and it was INCREDIBLE. Loved the flavor and the texture of each, will definitely be adding this to the list of regular items.

Stumbled upon this place and so glad we stopped in. A cute cafe that meets all of your healthy sandwich/coffee/salad needs.

I had a hummus wrap that was filling, tasty and super fresh. We sat in the high, comfy sofa chairs at the window cove and loved lounging for a few before resuming our walk around the neighborhood.

Red Hook has what is easily the BEST bacon, egg and cheese I've ever had! I don't know what they do to it, but it is simply amazing and at $7 is a steal considering the $11 you'd pay a few doors down for a lesser quality bacon, egg and cheese.
Super friendly service and great coffee and food! I stopped in for a smoothie and a chickpea salad both were fantastic!

You could say I'm hooked... thank you for indulging me with that terrible pun. 

Cash only!! But they do have an ATM inside - not a big deal just be aware. 

Ambiance: 
+ Exposed brick, art on the wall
+ Nice music playlist to fit the chill relaxed vibe - also not very loud so found it ideal for work

Food:
+ Vegan friendly - ordered the vegan curried chicken
+ Huge portions of food - almost wish I did sandwich soup combo because half the sandwich was plenty

This was my first time eating at this establishment and I loved the CAT bagel sandwich. The tempeh was yummy but was not crunchy. I'd love to return to try other options. They do serve eggs and chicken for people who prefer those options. They have coffee, teas, and hot chocolate as  a few of their drink options.
Delicious, fresh amazing food in a cute neighborhood cafe serving vegan and vegetarian dishes as well as pastries and baked goods!! My favorite breakfast wrap in the city--the Huevos Banditos!!

Awesome atmosphere, dank food and good coffee. And good people too! 
Get the vegan BLT-A, even if you aren't vegan. For like $7 it's a hearty (and heart healthy) breakfast or lunch, and comes with a side of some really good potato salad (also vegan!). 10/10 wish this place was in my neighborhood

I'm trying really hard to not let one bad apple ruin the bunch, but let me tell you about that apple:

I came in one Saturday morning, having strolled around the neighborhood and saw this place. Grabbed a menu and brought it home. It looked like they had a lot of vegan and gluten free options and even encourages you to customize the menu, so my roommate and I decided to order dinner from here! We called 1 hour to close (we live a few blocks away) and while I can't remember what she ordered, I know that I got the BLT + A. Everything was fine and dandy until we got there and realized it's cash only (I know, I'm one of those people but it's 2017! Come on!) So my roommate goes to take out cash and I noticed the bill was incredibly high. I asked to look at the receipt and see we were charged an EXTRA $2 for EACH sandwich for the avocado. I asked the woman at the front what that was for, and she pointed to a sign on the counter that said that avocado would be a $2 upcharge because of demand or something like that. So, let me tell you that both sandwiches are ALREADY made with avocado, with mine having "avocado" in the name. How are you going to charge $2 for a few slices of avocado on a $6 sandwich? That makes no sense. I would understand if I added avocado to an existing sandwich that didn't already have one, but the $6 price already reflects the cost of the avocado. My second qualm here is that when we called, WE WERE NEVER TOLD OF THE UPCHARGE! I would have gotten something else with no issue. 

When both of these points were raised to the extremely rude worker at the front, she scowled and gave myself and my roommate and attitude. I asked for the manager and she said that they were not there and "even if they were here, they would say the same thing." Words cannot describe how incredibly rude this woman/girl...I'll call her a girl...was to us. No "I'm sorry for the misunderstanding. Unfortunately this is our current policy. I'd be happy to remove the avocado for you if you wouldn't like to pay" or anything pleasant of the sort! We left without the food. 

So that was the one bad apple. However, I decided to give it another try yesterday morning because I really do love gluten free and vegan foods. This experience was significantly better. I essentially took like 5 things off of the menu in other items and created my own "concoction" and they were very accommodating and helpful! They even made the thing look pretty, too! 

Overall, I think I will be back...just not at night when that awful person is there. Remember it's CASH ONLY, though!
Cute and quaint restaurant with great prices, delicious food, and reasonable portion sizes. This was our go-to breakfast stop for the majority of our trip.

Adorable cafe with excellent food.  Exposed brick walls with a gritty feel yet the cuisine is clean, crisp, fresh, and delicious.   Super vegan friendly with extraordinary cafe fare!   

I got the Vegan Curried Chicken Salad Wrap.  Contrra with lettuce, tomatoes, cranberries, carrots, onions, avocados on a wheat wrap.  ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!!!   Paired with a side of Vegan/Gluten Free Potato Salad this was an excellent lunch.  They offer melts, soups, sandwiches, sales, breakfast, and wraps.  Awesome.   GO HERE!

Fast internet & power for the laptop warriors. Sunny and not too crowded if you want to hang out. Coffee is decent, peach green iced tea is very refreshing. Punk rock and pop on the stereo and quirky local art for sale on the walls. Nice joint!

I want to love this place because it has excellent food and a great location, but the staff attitude is really what kills the experience. I always feel like they wish I hadn't come, or I'm asking stupid questions. Not friendly at all.

Very creative sandwiches, however after my first visit, the thing that I'm most impressed with is the potato salad!!!! It is hands down some of the best I've ever had, and I can not wait to get back for more!

I just went here today and bumped into it by accident. I am vegan and can't say there are too many options for me everywhere. There was a wide selection of food for me to select from. Everything is priced so cheap and the food was amazing. The vegan BLT was awesome but the potato salad that came with it was the best potato salad I have ever had! Definitely will be coming back soon.

Got my hair done around the corner and have never really been out in this area before so I figured I stop by Redhook for a quick caffeine fix and a bite. I got Shade of Egg which was amazing. Everything was fresh and the sandwich was huge ! They give you a side rice/chickpea salad was which was bomb. This is definitely a "don't judge a book by its cover" place because the atmosphere makes it look a little grunge, but it's a cool vibe if that's what you're into.
They have the very BEST curry chicken salad wrap EVER!  I get it on a fairly regular basis and it is alway good.  Today it was incredible!  Thank you!  I also like their soy latte a lot too!
